meanings.definition: Express the meaning of using different words, especially to achieve greater clarity.
meanings.sent1: She paraphrased the poem to make it easier to understand.
meanings.sent2: He always paraphrased his ideas to make them clearer.
meanings.sent3: The teacher paraphrased the assignment instructions in a funny way.
meanings.sent4: Her explanation was like a paraphrased version of a complex puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The student paraphrased the historical event to make it more interesting.

meanings.definition: A reworded version of a text or speech.
meanings.sent1: The article included a helpful paraphrased summary at the end.
meanings.sent2: I prefer reading the paraphrased version of the story.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's joke was a clever paraphrased version of a famous speech.
meanings.sent4: The paraphrased quote became a popular saying among friends.
meanings.sent5: The paraphrased paragraph stood out in the essay for its clarity.
